author: chris2_2_2
content: Given what happened during Berlin are there any plans to delay 1559 until it can be better tested on a test net more reflective of the main net? (Asking as an eth holder here not a miner)

author: sky.cactus
content: Why are you trying to optimize for terseness <@543900561460822016> <@508125616940515329>?  Programming is like 1% typing, 30% reading, and 69% thinking.  Terseness only helps in the typing portion, and hurts in the other two.

author: lightclient
content: I feel like the proposed terms are better for typing, reading, and thinking about ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: Hey guys, we from JS synced with aleut yesterday. I noticed two things: there are not many txs at all and the BASEFEE opcode is not tested. I will probably spend part of today to beef up the network ðŸ˜„

author: jochembrouwer
content: Also the base fee is stuck at 7, have not checked, but this seems to be the floor of base fee?

author: sky.cactus
content: IIRC it can't go lower due to the nature of integer division.

author: sky.cactus
content: An accident deemed not worth fixing IIRC.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yeah let's just check if it is not trapped at this lower bound

author: timbeiko
content: <@!508125616940515329> we checked this on an old testnet with Besu <> Nethermind and Geth, but we should definitely check it again ðŸ™‚

author: timbeiko
content: No, I'm not sure how a delay would help? Obviously if something comes up during testing, we will adapt, and we've learned from the Berlin incident about how to improve our testing configs, but I'm not sure what more we can do?

author: timbeiko
content: Is it worth making an explicit discussion item for Friday's ACD about the JSON RPC spec? I think this is 1/2 of what we're missing for London in terms of devnets, the other being the refund removal EIP.
